    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Rapid getInstance(java.lang.String apiKey)
        Use this method to obtain specific Rapid instance in case you have initialized more than one instance in a single app

        If you have initialized only one instance of Rapid, you can use getInstance() to obtain the instance

        Parameters:
        apiKey - Rapid.io API key (you can get it in the developer's console)
        Returns:
        instance of Rapid

      • getInstance

        public static Rapid getInstance()
        Use this method to obtain default Rapid instance initialized by calling initialize(String)

        If you have initialized multiple Rapid instances, use getInstance(String) to obtain the right instance

        Returns:
        instance of Rapid

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(java.lang.String apiKey)
        Initialize Rapid instance with an Rapid.io API key

        You can substitute this call by including API key in AndroidManifest file within <application> tag

        Example: 

         
 <manifest>
 	<application>
 		//...
 		<meta-data
 			android:name="io.rapid.apikey"
 			android:value="<API_KEY>" />
 	</application>
 </manifest>
        Parameters:
        apiKey - Rapid.io API key (you can get it in the developer's console)

      • collection

        public <T> RapidCollectionReference<T> collection(java.lang.String collectionName,
                                                  java.lang.Class<T> itemClass)
        Get collection reference RapidCollectionReference to create subscriptions and/or mutate the documents

        With provided class reference for serialization/deserialization Rapid is able to automatically map document properties to object properties in Java class. By default the documents are serialized/deserialized by Gson, but you can provide own implementation of RapidJsonConverter via setJsonConverter(RapidJsonConverter) method

        If you don't want to convert data to a Java class, you can call collection(String) and data will be provided as a Map

        Parameters:
        collectionName - collection name
        itemClass - class used for serializing/deserializing documents
        Returns:
        collection reference

      • collection

        public RapidCollectionReference<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> collection(java.lang.String collectionName)
        Get collection reference RapidCollectionReference to create subscriptions and/or mutate the documents

        Data will be provided as a Map

        If you want Rapid to convert JSON automatically to Java objects, use collection(String, Class)

        Parameters:
        collectionName - collection name
        Returns:
        collection reference

      • authorize

        public RapidFuture authorize(java.lang.String authorizationToken)
        Authorize with an authorization token

        Data from collection are readable/writable/editable based on rules included inside the token itself.

        Parameters:
        authorizationToken - Authorization token
        Returns:
        RapidFuture for handling result of the process

      • deauthorize

        public RapidFuture deauthorize()
        Cancels existing authorization
        Returns:
        RapidFuture for handling result of the process

      • getJsonConverter

        public RapidJsonConverter getJsonConverter()
        Get JSON converter used for serialization and deserialization to/from Java objects.

        By default, Gson is used for this task. Use setJsonConverter(RapidJsonConverter) to provide custom converter

        Returns:
        RapidJsonConverter

      • setJsonConverter

        public void setJsonConverter(RapidJsonConverter jsonConverter)
        Set JSON converter used for serialization and deserialization to/from Java objects.

        By default, Gson is used for this task

        Parameters:
        jsonConverter - Custom JSON converter

      • getApiKey

        public java.lang.String getApiKey()
        Get Rapid.io API key this instance was initialized with
        Returns:
        Rapid.io API key

      • addConnectionStateListener

        public void addConnectionStateListener(RapidConnectionStateListener listener)
        Method for setting connection state listener.

        Possible states: ConnectionState.CONNECTED

        ConnectionState.CONNECTING

        ConnectionState.DISCONNECTED

        Method for enabling/disabling subscription disk cache
        Parameters:
        cachingEnabled -

      • setCacheSize

        public void setCacheSize(int cacheSizeInMb)
        Adjust subscription disk cache size

        Default size is 50 MB

        Parameters:
        cacheSizeInMb - Cache size in MB

      • setLogLevel

        public void setLogLevel(int level)
        Set level of Logcat output

        LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_NONE - no logs at all

        LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_ERRORS - log only errors

        LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_WARNINGS - log errors and warnings

        LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_INFO - log errors, warnings and informative messages useful for debugging

        LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_VERBOSE - log everything

        Parameters:
        level - desired log level

      • isAuthenticated

        public boolean isAuthenticated()
        Get current authentication state
        Returns:
        true when authenticated

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public void setConnectionTimeout(long connectionTimeoutInMs)
        Set network connection timeout for subscriptions and mutations

        By default, Rapid SDK will keep trying to perform database operations until they are successful

        Parameters:
        connectionTimeoutInMs - Connection timeout in milliseconds
